data: PLASURG Autologous Microsurgical Breast Reconstruction - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue PLASURG Breast Surgery/Reconstruction Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
If urine output is less than 30 mL/h for 2 consecutive hours, notify resident / fellow or attending
q12h, for 48 hour, assess breast and axilla for bleeding, swelling, and bruising
q12h, for 24 hour, assess donor site
Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, q1h, For 48 hour
T+2;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, q2h, For 48 hour
T+4;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, q4h, For 48 hour
T+6;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, q6h, Until discharge
Site: Breast flap(s), Venous Doppler or GEM Doppler q1h for 48 hours, then q2h for 48 hours, q4h for 48 hours then q6h until discharge
Site: Breast flap(s), Arterial Doppler at stitch q1h for 48 hours, then q2h for 48 hours, then q4h for 48 hours, then q6h until discharge
T+2;N, Site: Breast flap(s), Discontinue flap dressing post-op day 2
Site: Donor site, Reinforce PRN, Change dressing on post-op day 2
Strip and empty q6h and PRN. Record each drain site output individually.
Teach patient to strip drain and record output q12h and PRN
Patient may shower 24 hours after all drains are removed
Supine, head of bed at 45 degrees, knees flexed, no trapeze on bed
Apply Full Leg Sequential Compression Devices
Apply Full Leg Graduated Compression Stocking
Other (please specify), Warm room to 30 degrees for 5 days
81 mg, PO, qdaily with food, drug form: tab-EC
1 application, topical, as directed, order duration: 7 day, drug form: oint

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: bag
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 24 hour
1 g, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
1 tab, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
q1h for 2 hour, then  q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hours, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hours, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hours, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then  q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hours, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
24 hour, Except for Medications With Sips of Water
Start: NPO, for 24 hours, Caffeine/Xanthine Free
Post-op day 2 if drinking well. Remove saline lock when IV antibiotics discontinued
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
